_comment: SCOTUS Eval Gold Set — 10 hand-verified cases spanning all severity levels. Source: DB + CourtListener + SCOTUS opinion text verification. Created Session 1 (2026-02-24).

cases.expected_winner: Dwayne Barrett / criminal defendants facing double convictions
cases.expected_loser: federal prosecutors seeking multiple convictions for single acts
cases.notes: 9-0 unanimous (Jackson authored). One act cannot yield two convictions under §924(c)(1)(A)(i) and §924(j). Clear people-win. Currently over-rated at level 3.

cases.case_name: Department of Agriculture Rural Development Rural Housing Service v. Kirtz
cases.expected_winner: Reginald Kirtz / consumers with inaccurate credit reports
cases.expected_loser: federal agencies that report false credit information
cases.notes: 9-0 unanimous (Gorsuch authored). Consumers can sue federal agencies under FCRA. Enrichment fabricates 'dissent, Jackson J.' in evidence_anchors — there was no dissent.

cases.expected_winner: veterans like Simon Soto seeking combat-related compensation
cases.expected_loser: federal government seeking to limit retroactive benefit payments
cases.notes: Thomas authored. Veterans get CRSC without Barring Act cap. Enrichment cites 'Judge Reyna' (Federal Circuit judge, not SCOTUS justice) in dissent_highlights — factual error.

cases.expected_winner: IRS / federal government on estate tax valuation
cases.expected_loser: Connelly estate / closely-held business owners on tax planning
cases.notes: 9-0 unanimous (Thomas authored). Technical estate tax ruling about share redemption valuation. No rights at stake, no power grab. Currently over-rated at level 4.

cases.case_name: Royal Canin U. S. A. v. Wullschleger
cases.expected_winner: Anastasia Wullschleger / consumers challenging deceptive marketing
cases.expected_loser: Royal Canin USA / corporations trying to keep cases in federal court
cases.notes: Kagan authored. Technical jurisdiction ruling — case remanded to state court after federal claims dropped. Currently over-rated at level 4.

cases.expected_winner: Department of Veterans Affairs retaining discretion over claims
cases.expected_loser: veterans like Joshua Bufkin seeking disability benefits
cases.notes: Thomas authored. VA disability claims harder to challenge. Jackson + Gorsuch dissented. Genuine institutional harm to veterans. Level 3-4 appropriate.

cases.expected_winner: federal government shielded by sovereign immunity
cases.expected_loser: bankruptcy trustees / creditors seeking to reclaim misappropriated funds
cases.notes: Jackson authored. Sovereign immunity blocks bankruptcy trustees from using state-law claims against federal government. Gorsuch dissented. Level 3-4 appropriate.

cases.expected_loser: TikTok users / free speech advocates / 170 million users
cases.notes: Per curiam. TikTok ban upheld under national security rationale. Sotomayor dissented in part. Genuine First Amendment restriction. Level 4-5 appropriate.

cases.expected_winner: Trump / future candidates facing state-level disqualification
cases.expected_loser: Colorado voters / states seeking to enforce Section 3
cases.notes: Per curiam. States cannot enforce 14th Amendment Section 3 against federal candidates. Separate concurrences from liberal justices. Level 4-5 appropriate.

cases.expected_winner: state officials shielded from fee-shifting accountability
cases.expected_loser: civil rights plaintiffs who won preliminary injunctions but cannot recover fees
cases.notes: Roberts authored. Preliminary injunctions don't confer prevailing-party status for attorney's fees. Bad for access to justice but NOT a constitutional crisis. Currently over-rated at level 5.
